speaker: Nora
text: Did you hear what the client said during today's meeting?
ipa: dɪdʒə hɪɹ wʌt ðə ˈklaɪənt sɛd ˈdʊrɪŋ təˈdeɪz ˈmitɪŋ
stress: Did you HEAR | what the CLIENT SAID | during TODAY’S MEETING
linking:
"did you" → /dɪdʒə/ (reduction)
"what the" → /wʌt ðə/ (t + the)
"during today’s" → /ˈdʊrɪŋ təˈdeɪz/ (smooth flow)

speaker: Leo
text: Yeah, they complained that the new dashboard wasn't loading fast enough.
ipa: jæ | ðeɪ kəmˈpleɪnd ðət ðə nu ˈdæʃˌbɔɹd ˈwɑzənt ˈloʊdɪŋ fæst əˈnʌf
stress: Yeah | they COMPLAINED | that the NEW DASHBOARD | wasn’t LOADING FAST ENOUGH
linking:
"that the" → /ðət ðə/ (smooth reduction)
"wasn't loading" → /ˈwɑzənt ˈloʊdɪŋ/ (linked n + l)

speaker: Nora
text: They also pointed out that some graphs weren't updating straight away.
ipa: ðeɪ ˈɔlsoʊ ˈpɔɪntɪd aʊt ðət səm ɡræfs ˈwɜɹnt ˈʌpˌdeɪtɪŋ streɪt əˈweɪ
stress: They ALSO POINTED OUT | that some GRAPHS | weren’t UPDATING STRAIGHT AWAY
linking:
"pointed out" → /ˈpɔɪntɪd aʊt/ (d + out smooth)
"straight away" → /streɪt əˈweɪ/ (t links to 'away')

speaker: Leo
text: Did they mention anything about the mobile version?
ipa: dɪd ðeɪ ˈmɛnʃən ˈɛniˌθɪŋ əˈbaʊt ðə ˈmoʊbəl ˈvɝʒən
stress: Did they MENTION ANYTHING | about the MOBILE VERSION
linking:
"did they" → /dɪd ðeɪ/ (smooth link)
"about the" → /əˈbaʊt ðə/ (t links into the)

speaker: Nora
text: Yes, they requested that we optimize the mobile UI and suggested that we conduct more testing over the following week.
ipa: jɛs | ðeɪ ɹɪˈkwɛstɪd ðət wi ˈɑptəˌmaɪz ðə ˈmoʊbəl juˈaɪ | ənd səɡˈʤɛstɪd ðət wi kənˈdʌkt mɔɹ ˈtɛstɪŋ ˈoʊvɚ ðə ˈfɑloʊɪŋ wik
stress: They REQUESTED | that we OPTIMIZE the MOBILE UI | and SUGGESTED we CONDUCT more TESTING over the FOLLOWING WEEK
linking:
"that we" → /ðət wi/ (t links to 'we')
"conduct more" → /kənˈdʌkt mɔɹ/ (t to m smooth)

speaker: Leo
text: Did they ask if the fix could be ready by next Friday?
ipa: dɪd ðeɪ æsk ɪf ðə fɪks kəd bi ˈrɛdi baɪ nɛkst ˈfraɪdeɪ
stress: Did they ASK | if the FIX could be READY by NEXT FRIDAY
linking:
"could be" → /kəd bi/ (smooth reduction)
"ready by" → /ˈrɛdi baɪ/ (y + b link)

speaker: Nora
text: They asked whether it would be possible. I promised that we would do our best, but I warned that it might take a bit longer depending on QA results.
ipa: ðeɪ æskt ˈwɛðɚ ɪt wəd bi ˈpɑsəbəl | aɪ ˈprɑmɪst ðət wi wəd du aʊɚ bɛst | bət aɪ wɔrnd ðət ɪt maɪt teɪk ə bɪt ˈlɑŋɡɚ dɪˈpɛndɪŋ ɑn ˈkjuˈeɪ ɹɪˈzʌlts
stress: They ASKED WHETHER it would be POSSIBLE | I PROMISED we would DO our BEST | but I WARNED it MIGHT take a BIT LONGER depending on QA RESULTS
linking:
"it would" → /ɪt wəd/ (t + would)
"might take" → /maɪt teɪk/ (clear T but connected)
"bit longer" → /bɪt ˈlɑŋɡɚ/ (t to L flow)

speaker: Leo
text: Did they propose any specific improvements?
ipa: dɪd ðeɪ pɹəˈpoʊz ˈɛni spəˈsɪfɪk ɪmˈpɹuvmənts
stress: Did they PROPOSE any SPECIFIC IMPROVEMENTS
linking:
"did they" → /dɪd ðeɪ/ (smooth link)
"specific improvements" → /spəˈsɪfɪk ɪmˈpɹuvmənts/ (connected speech)

speaker: Nora
text: They proposed simplifying the navigation and offered to send a few UX suggestions tomorrow.
ipa: ðeɪ pɹəˈpoʊzd ˈsɪmpləˌfaɪɪŋ ðə ˌnævəˈɡeɪʃən ənd ˈɔfɚd tə sɛnd ə fju ˌjuˈɛks səɡˈʤɛstʃənz təˈmɑɹoʊ
stress: They PROPOSED SIMPLIFYING the NAVIGATION and OFFERED to SEND a few UX SUGGESTIONS TOMORROW
linking:
"offered to" → /ˈɔfɚd tə/ (d links to 'to')
"send a few" → /sɛnd ə fju/ (d links to 'a')

speaker: Leo
text: Nice. I think we ought to schedule another review meeting next week to show them the updates.
ipa: naɪs | aɪ θɪŋk wi ɔt tə ˈskɛʤuəl əˈnʌðɚ ɹɪˈvju ˈmitɪŋ nɛkst wik tə ʃoʊ ðəm ði ˈʌpˌdeɪts
stress: Nice. I THINK we OUGHT to SCHEDULE another REVIEW MEETING next WEEK to SHOW them the UPDATES
linking:
"ought to" → /ɔt tə/ (reduction of 'to')
"schedule another" → /ˈskɛʤuəl əˈnʌðɚ/ (linking 'schedule' to 'another')

speaker: Nora
text: Good idea. By the way, they reminded us that the reporting module had to be compliant with the new accessibility standards.
ipa: ɡʊd aɪˈdiə | baɪ ðə weɪ | ðeɪ ɹɪˈmaɪndɪd əs ðət ðə ɹɪˈpɔɹtɪŋ ˈmɑʤul həd tə bi kəmˈplaɪənt wɪð ðə nu əkˌsɛsəˈbɪləti ˈstændɚdz
stress: Good IDEA. By the WAY, they REMINDED us that the REPORTING MODULE had to be COMPLIANT with the new ACCESSIBILITY STANDARDS
linking:
"reminded us" → /ɹɪˈmaɪndɪd əs/ (d links to 'us')
"had to" → /həd tə/ (reduction of 'to')

speaker: Leo
text: Right. According to the notes I took, they seemingly care a lot about screen reader compatibility too.
ipa: ɹaɪt | əˈkɔɹdɪŋ tə ðə noʊts aɪ tʊk | ðeɪ ˈsiːmɪŋli kɛɹ ə lɑt əˈbaʊt skɹin ˈɹiːdɚ ˌkɑmpəˈtɪbəlɪti tu
stress: Right. According to the NOTES I TOOK, they SEEMINGLY CARE a LOT about SCREEN READER COMPATIBILITY too
linking:
"according to" → /əˈkɔɹdɪŋ tə/ (g links to 'to')
"lot about" → /lɑt əˈbaʊt/ (t links to 'about')

speaker: Nora
text: Exactly. Let’s make sure to prioritize that before our next client call.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli | lɛts meɪk ʃʊɹ tə praɪˈɔɹɪˌtaɪz ðət bɪˈfɔɹ aʊɚ nɛkst ˈklaɪənt kɔl
stress: Exactly. Let’s MAKE sure to PRIORITIZE that BEFORE our NEXT CLIENT CALL
linking:
"let's make" → /lɛts meɪk/ (s links to 'make')
"prioritize that" → /praɪˈɔɹɪˌtaɪz ðət/ (z links to 'that')
